T1595.name: Active Scanning
T1595.description: Adversaries may execute active reconnaissance scans to gather information that can be used during targeting.
detection_methods: Monitor network traffic for scanning patterns
Analyze firewall logs for repeated connection attempts

T1595.001.name: Active Scanning: Scanning IP Blocks
T1595.001.description: Adversaries may scan victim IP blocks to gather information for targeting.
mitigations: Deploy intrusion detection systems to detect port scans
Configure firewalls to block scanning IPs
detection_methods: Monitor for high-volume connection refusals
Analyze network flows for IP sweep patterns

T1595.002.name: Active Scanning: Vulnerability Scanning
T1595.002.description: Adversaries may scan for vulnerabilities in public-facing systems to identify exploitable weaknesses.
detection_methods: Monitor for known scanning tool signatures (e.g., nmap, nikto)
Analyze HTTP logs for vulnerability scan patterns

T1589.name: Gather Victim Network Information
T1589.description: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's network, such as DNS details or network topology.
detection_methods: Monitor DNS logs for AXFR attempts
Use DNS query logging to detect reconnaissance

T1078.name: Valid Accounts
T1078.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse valid accounts to gain initial access, persistence, or privilege escalation.
detection_methods: Monitor authentication logs for unusual patterns
Use SIEM to detect account misuse

T1078.001.name: Valid Accounts: Default Accounts
T1078.001.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of a default account as a means to gain Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.
mitigations: Ensure default accounts are disabled or have strong passwords
detection_methods: Monitor authentication logs for default account usage
Use SIEM to detect repeated failed logins

T1110.001.name: Brute Force: Password Guessing
T1110.001.description: Adversaries may use password guessing to attempt to access accounts.
mitigations: Implement account lockout after failed attempts
detection_methods: Monitor for multiple failed login attempts
Analyze authentication logs for brute force patterns

T1133.name: External Remote Services
T1133.description: Adversaries may leverage external-facing remote services (e.g., RDP, VPN) to gain initial access.
mitigations: Restrict RDP access to specific IPs
Use strong authentication for remote services
detection_methods: Monitor RDP and VPN logs for unusual access
Use network monitoring for suspicious connections

T1204.002.name: User Execution: Malicious File
T1204.002.description: Adversaries may rely on user execution of malicious files to achieve code execution.
mitigations: Implement endpoint protection to block malicious files
Educate users on safe file handling
detection_methods: Monitor for execution of suspicious file types
Analyze endpoint logs for malicious file execution

T1021.002.name: Remote Services: SMB/Windows Admin Shares
T1021.002.description: Adversaries may use SMB or Windows Admin Shares for lateral movement within a network.
mitigations: Restrict SMB access to trusted IPs
detection_methods: Monitor SMB logs for unauthorized access
Use IDS to detect suspicious SMB activity

T1105.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
T1105.description: Adversaries may transfer tools or other files to a victim system to enable further malicious activity.
mitigations: Monitor network traffic for suspicious file transfers
Use endpoint detection to block known malicious files
detection_methods: Analyze HTTP/SMB logs for suspicious file downloads
Use EDR to detect tool execution

T1566.001.name: Phishing: Spearphishing Attachment
T1566.001.description: Adversaries may send spearphishing emails with malicious attachments to gain initial access.
mitigations: Implement email filtering to block malicious attachments
Use antivirus to scan email attachments
detection_methods: Monitor email logs for suspicious attachments
Analyze network traffic for malicious file downloads

T1550.002.name: Use Alternate Authentication Material: Pass the Hash
T1550.002.description: Adversaries may use stolen NTLM hashes to authenticate to other systems.
detection_methods: Monitor NTLM authentication logs
Use SIEM to detect hash-based authentication

T1027.004.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Compile After Delivery
T1027.004.description: Adversaries may attempt to make payloads difficult to analyze by delivering files that require compilation.
mitigations: Use endpoint protection to detect obfuscated files
detection_methods: Analyze HTTP logs for obfuscated payloads
Use EDR to detect compilation processes

T1071.name: Application Layer Protocol
T1071.description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering.
detection_methods: Monitor for unusual application layer protocol traffic
Analyze network flows for anomalies

T1071.001.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
T1071.001.description: Adversaries may use web protocols (e.g., HTTP/HTTPS) for command and control, possibly with outdated user-agents.
mitigations: Monitor HTTP/HTTPS traffic for suspicious user-agents
detection_methods: Inspect HTTP headers for outdated or suspicious user-agents
Use IDS/IPS for web protocol anomalies

T1071.003.name: Application Layer Protocol: Mail Protocols
T1071.003.description: Adversaries may use mail protocols (e.g., IRC) for command and control.
detection_methods: Analyze IRC traffic for anomalies
Use SIEM to detect C2 communication

T1071.004.name: Application Layer Protocol: DNS
T1071.004.description: Adversaries may use DNS for command and control, including DNS tunneling.
mitigations: Monitor DNS queries for unusual patterns
detection_methods: Analyze DNS query lengths and frequencies
Use DNS security solutions

T1562.001.name: Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools
T1562.001.description: Adversaries may disable or modify security tools to avoid detection.
mitigations: Monitor for changes to security tools
Use tamper protection for EDR solutions
Implement logging for tool configuration changes
detection_methods: Monitor EDR logs for disablement attempts
Analyze system logs for unauthorized changes

T1573.name: Encrypted Channel
T1573.description: Adversaries may use encrypted channels (e.g., self-signed SSL/TLS) for command and control.
detection_methods: Analyze SSL/TLS logs for self-signed certificates
Use network monitoring for encrypted C2

T1190.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
T1190.description: Adversaries may attempt to exploit vulnerabilities in internet-facing applications.
detection_methods: Monitor for SQL injection patterns
Use WAF logs to detect exploit attempts

T1485.name: Data Destruction
T1485.description: Adversaries may destroy data to disrupt operations or cover their tracks.
mitigations: Use access controls on critical data
detection_methods: Monitor database logs for DROP/DELETE commands
Use SIEM to detect data destruction patterns

T1210.name: Exploitation of Remote Services
T1210.description: Adversaries may exploit remote services to gain unauthorized access or move laterally.
detection_methods: Analyze RPC logs for exploit attempts
Use IDS to detect service exploitation
